What We've Learned Updated: EMC host certificate was installed to the Trusted ROOT store.

We added the other EMC cluster host to NAM to match the FQDN name seen within Netwrix Enterprise Auditor (NEA) via Robert Parsons Implementation.

We did noted that the initial Agent log path was for the HQ..FS02 host via NetBIOS name.

Next Steps Updated: Contacts are going to check with their Dell EMC support to see why we are seeing the API/Web auth issues.

They will confirm that the needed Isilon Noted are forwarding event to the needed CEE agent system.

What We've Learned Updated: Current ISSUE: NEA host/Account are not able to read the Reg on the NAM Agent host.

 
PRIOR ISSUE:
EMC host certificate was installed to the Trusted ROOT store.

We added the other EMC cluster host to NAM to match the FQDN name seen within Netwrix Enterprise Auditor (NEA) via Robert Parsons Implementation.

We did noted that the initial Agent log path was for the HQ..FS02 host via NetBIOS name.

Next Steps Updated: Correct the Remote Reg access issue.

Contacts are going to check with their Dell EMC support to see why we are seeing the API/Web auth issues.

They will confirm that the needed Isilon Noted are forwarding event to the needed CEE agent system.

Next Steps Updated: CURRENT:  Correct the Remote Reg access issue.

PRIOR:       Contacts are going to check with their Dell EMC support to see why we are seeing the OneFS API/Web auth issues.

They will confirm that the needed Isilon Noted are forwarding event to the needed CEE agent system.

@Dusty Grayson​ 

Can we access ComputerHKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESYSTEMControlSet001ServicesSBTLoggingParameters via Remote Regedit to fmeisdg05 when logged in as the NEA service account? If not, we want to check the specific permissions on this entry

Unable to replicate in my lab.

 

Reliably Repro'd in Customer Envi

 

Troubleshooting completed/Notes:

Confirmed the FSAC job & Proxy settings.
